title: Vignesh custodial death case: Post-mortem reveals multiple wounds, fracture - The News Minute
content:
1. Vignesh custodial death case: Post-mortem reveals multiple wounds, fracture  The News Minute
  2. Chennai man who died in police custody sustained fracture and multiple injuries, shows post-mortem  Scroll.in
  3. Death in judicial custody: Tiruvannamalai man died due to seizures, Stalin says  Times of India
  4. TN DGP Sylendra Babu asks police not to detain suspects at night  The New Indian Express
  5. If Vignesh died in police custody, it is murder: SC/ST commission official on TN custodial death  India Today
  6. View Full coverage on Google News
description: The post-mortem report of Vignesh, who died in police custody in Chennai, has confirmed that the 25-year-old suffered multiple injuries on his body. Vignesh, who used to offer horse rides at the city’s Marina Beach, was taken into custody by the G5 Secretariat Colony police station, along with Suresh, a construction worker, on April 18. The Chennai police had claimed that Vignesh had a seizure and died while being taken to the hospital. The family countered their claim, alleging foul play in his death. Now, the post mortem report has also contradicted the police’s version of events.
